_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



"Fundamental to Lubrizol's business is protecting our employees, customers, suppliers, contractors and visitors, as well as, the environment and communities in which we operate.  Lubrizol's culture of commitment to the continual improvement of HSES performance worldwide is a core value and an essential part of our success."

From: The Lubrizol Corporation Health, Safety, Environmental and Security Policy, January 2017





The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:



The Lubrizol Corporation (Lubrizol) participates in Responsible Care®, a program of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) launched in 1988.  Through Responsible Care®, companies are committed to a continuing effort to improve the responsible management of chemicals. Accordingly, we believe and subscribe to the principles of the program including:

      - To lead our companies in ethical ways that increasingly benefit society, the economy and the environment.

      - To design and develop products that can be manufactured, transported, used and disposed of or recycled safely.

      - To work with customers, carriers, suppliers, distributors and contractors to foster the safe and secure use, transport and disposal of chemicals and provide hazards   and risk information that can be accesses and applied in their operations and products.

      - To design and operate our facilities in a safe, secure and environmentally sound manner.

      - To instill a culture throughout all levels of our organizations to continually identify, reduce and manage process safety risks.

      - To promote pollution prevention, minimization of waste and conservation of energy and other critical resources at every stage of the life cycle of our products.

      - To cooperate with governments at all levels of our organizations in the development of effective and efficient safety, health, environmental and security laws, regulations and standards.

      - To support educa

tion and research on the health, safety, environmental effects and security of our products and processes.

      - To communicate product, service and process risks to our stakeholders and listen to and consider their perspectives.

      - To make continual progress towards our goal of no accidents, injuries or harm to human health and the environment from our products and operations and openly report our health, safety, environmental and security performance.

      - To seek continual improvement in our integrated Responsible Care Management System® to address environmental, health, safety and security performance.

      - To promote Responsible Care® by encouraging and assisting others to adhere to these Guiding Principles.  



The Lubrizol Painesville Facility is registered to ISO 14001:2015 and RC 14001:2015 EHS&S and RC(R); management systems.   To achieve these certifications, a third party auditor conducts a formal pre-assessment followed by a final certification audit in order to certify that our management systems are functioning and conform to the international environmental standards for ISO 14001 and the ACC Technical Specification for RC 14001.  



The Lubrizol Painesville facility has integrated environmental, health, safety and security (EHS&S) responsibilities and accountability into the organization.  We believe that ownership for these issues is at the operating level and that safety is everyone's job.  We are committed to operating our facility in compliance with applicable EHS&S laws and consistent with Responsible Care®.  This is the philosophy that we communicate to our employees and that provides the grounding for our daily operations.  We believe that this philosophy is critical to our progress and a key contributor to the continued success of the Lubrizol Painesville facility.



As part of the safety program, all new employees go through a safety orientation program. This includes but is not limited to the correct use of p

ersonal protection equipment, safe practices on the job and awareness and use of emergency equipment.



A training program is in place to train employees and contractors to reach and maintain proficiency in safe work practices and maintain the skills and knowledge necessary to perform their jobs. The training facility, which is housed in a renovated old production building, provides employees the opportunity to train in a plant environment on safety procedures such as hot work, line breaking, confined space entry, and lockout-tag out.



Multiple layers of protection are developed and put in place on all processes to prevent accidental releases. Equipment is expertly designed according to strict engineering standards. Safety reviews are conducted on new and modified processes and equipment during design and before start-up. A maintenance and inspection program is conducted and documented to ensure facility soundness.



Lubrizol's ongoing process safety program includes a measurement of performance, audits and implementation of corrective actions. This continuous management of the system assures that safety is always the top priority.



If an emergency were to occur, we have a trained and certified emergency response organization staffed 24 hours a day to immediately react and mitigate the emergency. In addition, if we need additional assistance we have an established working relationship and direct communication with the local Lake County Fire Departments.





The facility and the regulated substances handled:

 

Lubrizol Painesville is a specialty manufacturing facility. We are a leading supplier of performance chemicals to international lubricant, fuel and industrial markets. Our processing areas consist of vessels and associated piping, valves and other ancillary equipment.

 

All of the chemicals listed below are used in processes to manufacture these products. The maximum quantity represents the maximum amount stored in a vessel and/or process at any time

governed by administrative control through standard operating procedures.

 

The stationary source, Lubrizol's Painesville Plant facility I.D. number 0243000024, handles the following regulated substances:



Toxics:



CAS No.     Chemical name                                        Max.Qty. (Lbs.)



75-56-9     Propylene oxide [Oxirane, methyl-]                    180,000*

302-01-2    Hydrazine                                             77,000*

7783-06-4   Hydrogen sulfide                                      32,000

75-15-0     Carbon disulfide                                      76,000*



Flammables:



CAS No.       Chemical name                                       Max.Qty. (Lbs.)



115-11-7       2-Methylpropene (1-Propene, 2-methyl-)              390,000**



*Max. Qty. (Lbs.) Has been updated to reflect Safe tops of tanks.

** Total Quantity consists of three tanks (Max. Qty. (Lbs.)).



The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:



Lubrizol's Painesville's facility is in compliance with the OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and EPA's accident prevention rule. Some of the key elements are as follows:



For each covered process, associated process safety information is maintained, multiple layers of protection are in place including safe design of equipment, emergency and control devices and instrumentation, safe operational procedures, monitoring equipment, back-up systems, maintenance and inspection programs and an established training system for all employees. All of these mechanisms are in place to prevent an accidental release.



The five-year accident history:



There were no incidents at the facility in the past five years that meet the definition of the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) reporting requirements.





The emergency response program:



Lubrizol maintains an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) at its facility located at 155 Freedom Rd., Painesville, Ohio 44077. There is an e

mergency response organization (ERO) in place twenty-four hours a day consisting of an incident commander and trained emergency responders. There are also certified hazardous material technicians, EMT's, rescue squad and paramedics on staff. The ERP is documented within Lubrizol Painesville's Intranet web site and is accessible to all Lubrizol-Painesville employees. The Plan includes procedures for the notification of local fire authorities and the local emergency planning committee (LEPC), both groups have copies of the ERP. The Lake County Emergency Management Agency maintains a public notification and alert system capable of notifying the surrounding community as needed. There is continuous training of Lubrizol's ERO personnel on and off site and in conjunction with the local emergency responders. The ERP is updated as changes are needed.  The Lubrizol-Painesville Emergency Response & Security Superintendent is part of the County committee that revises the community emergency response plan.  A large scale drill was conducted in October 2018 with Lake County Hazmat Team, EMA, and local fire departments.  A tabletop exercise related to the facility's ERP is being planned with the LEPC. 



Planned changes to improve safety:



An environmental, health and safety corrective action and preventive action system exists to address all odors, spills, injuries and near misses at the facility. This system documents the incident and includes information on the root cause & mitigation measures and the individual responsible for implementing the corrective and preventive actions. A system is in place to review progress towards completion of the corrective and preventive actions and to check the effectiveness of these actions.



Safety meetings and training are held on a regular basis to review these incidents to update employees on topics that will improve the overall environmental, health and safety of our facility and surrounding community.  Daily safety walks and procedur

es are in place to help guide employees to complete tasks appropriately.     



All the RMP covered processes undergo a process hazard analysis (PHA) on a routine basis to identify any potential hazards. If there are recommendation actions from these analyses, projects are initiated to address the recommendations as part of the facility's capital improvement process.  Past projects related to RMP regulated processes have included upgrades to fire suppressant systems and distributed control systems (DCS), level transmitters on vessels, replacement of liquid and vent piping, installation of safety barricades surrounding storage vessels, installation of sensors to detect a chemical release, replacement of metering devices on material feed lines and installation of additional emergency equipment.



These are some examples of Lubrizol's philosophy of responsibly maintaining a safe environment for its employees and the surrounding community.
